admission_text:
#### Unlock a deeper connection to New Brunswick’s rich history and natural wonders, while helping to preserve and share the stories that make our province unique.

Become a member and be part of something extraordinary! Your membership supports the preservation of New Brunswick’s history, culture, and natural heritage.   
  
Whether you’re a history enthusiast, nature lover, or lifelong learner, your membership helps keep the museum thriving for generations to come. Join today and explore, engage and connect!

Join Now
accessibility_text:
The deposit copy of Martha Langford’s long awaited book, _A History of Photography in Canada [Volume I – Anticipation to Participation]_ (McGill-Queen’s University Press, 2025) has just been received by the New Brunswick Museum’s Research Library.

The volume chronicles the reports of this new visual art form’s invention to its widespread adoption in Canada. Langford’s epic survey covers the first eighty years of photography’s establishment as a one of the primary tools for recording people, events, lives, and activities across the country. Eight photographs from the New Brunswick Museum help to tell the story.
